intro: Cunila platyphylla, commonly known as sweet cicely, is a herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its aromatic seeds are often used in culinary applications, adding a subtle anise-like flavor. Cunila platyphylla thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas.
